results.title: In the name of religion
results.creator_credit: James J. Cullen, J William Walker and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Minorities”.
Although religious freedom is guaranteed by the U.S. Constitution, prejudice against minority religious groups is a strong feature of American society. This film traces history of immigration and the growth of intolerance and persecution of religious minorities.

results.title: In the movies it doesn't hurt
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Barry Palin and Illustra Films
results.brief_description: Made in a style similar to the “Carry on” movies, this very funny film shows what should and shouldn’t be done in a school laboratory. Sid James features in a film clip and cast also includes Bernard Bresslaw and John Merrigan. NB: Some equipment shown is not used in Australian schools. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: In the form of clay
results.creator_credit: Olle Hallberg, Stig Lasseby, Tor Flyckt and Gustavsbergs Fabriker
results.brief_description: The procelain industry of Gustavsberg in Sweden is shown in all its aspects from the processing of the raw clay to the finished product; moulding and forming, the application of color and design by hand and machine followed by the glazing and firing. Features the designs of three of Sweden’s foremost craftsmen.

results.title: In the dark
results.creator_credit: David Eady, Ronald H. Riley and Ronald H Riley and Associates
results.brief_description: Shows what can be done to prevent a variety of accidents. Analyses one industrial accident and shows how easily the complacency of management, the foolishness of workers, domestic and social pressures can create danger - at work and at home - and can lead to years of heartbreak and hardship.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Eady, Ronald H. Riley and Ronald H Riley and Associates

results.title: In the bush [Greek Version]
results.brief_description: This film provides a view of some unique Australian birds and animals. In particular, the platypus, echidna, kangaroo and koala in natural surroundings. Commentary in Greek language only - no subtitles. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: In the bush
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A survey of some Australia’s unique native creatures, in particular, the marsupials. The platypus, echidna, koala and kangaroo in natural surroundings.

results.title: In the beginning
results.brief_description: An educational film taking as its starting point “All animals come from the egg”. Depicts with photography and diagrams, ovulation, fertilisation and early cell division of a rabbit embryo. Having depicted a number of scenes of dissection/vivisection, the film concludes with some footage of live animals and a human baby.

results.title: In song and dance
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Don Saunders, Joy Cavill, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Waratah Film Productions
results.brief_description: The preparations and some scenes of the 1964 Northern Territory Eisteddfod held at Darwin. Local townspeople are joined by cattlemen and First Nations people from far out stations, and get together to produce an eisteddfod unlike any other - with items of all kinds, from classical ballet to First Nations peoples’ music and dance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee Robinson, Don Saunders, Joy Cavill, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Waratah Film Productions

results.title: In signal honour: 1865-1965, 100 years of telecommunications
results.brief_description: Produced to celebrate the centenary (1865-1965) of the International Telecommunications Union, this film traces the development of telecommunications during the last hundred years, showing the emergence and impact of telephone, radio, television and apace communications. Highlights include international television transmissions.

results.title: In search of the bowhead whale
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Bill Brind, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An adventure film of a whaling expedition that included Scott McVay, an authority on whales, and filmmaker Bill Mason. The objective was to find and film the bowhead, a magnificent inhabitant of the cold Arctic seas brought to the edge of extinction by excessive commercial whaling. With helicopter and Inuit guide, aqualungs and underwater cameras, the expedition searches out and meets the bowhead and beluga. (Six awards, including New York; Columbus)
